meanings.definition: The state or quality of being permanent.
meanings.sent1: The permanentness of the structure ensured its stability for years to come.
meanings.sent2: The permanentness of the ink on the paper made the document official.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the permanentness of his bad haircut, saying it was a 'forever style'.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him had a permanentness that felt like an unbreakable bond.
meanings.sent5: The permanentness of the mountain range was a testament to the earth's enduring strength.

meanings.definition: The condition of being lasting or enduring.
meanings.sent1: The permanentness of their friendship was evident in their unwavering support for each other.
meanings.sent2: The permanentness of the paint on the walls meant they wouldn't have to repaint often.
meanings.sent3: The idea of the permanentness of a bubble bath amused the children, who thought it would last forever.
meanings.sent4: The permanentness of the oak tree's roots symbolized the deep connection to the land.
meanings.sent5: The permanentness of the star's glow in the night sky captivated all who gazed upon it.
